methods.description: View departures for all routes from a stop

parameters.name: route_type
parameters.description: Number identifying transport mode; values returned via RouteTypes API

parameters.name: stop_id
parameters.description: Identifier of stop; values returned by Stops API

parameters.name: platform_numbers
parameters.description: Filter by platform number at stop

parameters.name: direction_id
parameters.description: Filter by identifier of direction of travel; values returned by Directions API - /v3/directions/route/{route_id}

parameters.name: gtfs
parameters.description: Indicates that stop_id parameter will accept "GTFS stop_id" data

parameters.name: date_utc
parameters.description: Filter by the date and time of the request (ISO 8601 UTC format) (default = current date and time)

parameters.name: include_cancelled
parameters.description: Indicates if cancelled services (if they exist) are returned (default = false) - metropolitan train only

parameters.name: look_backwards
parameters.description: Indicates if filtering runs (and their departures) to those that arrive at destination before date_utc (default = false). Requires max_results > 0.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
List of objects to be returned in full (i.e. expanded) - options include: All, Stop, Route, Run, Direction, Disruption, VehiclePosition, VehicleDescriptor or None.
            Run must be expanded to receive VehiclePosition and VehicleDescriptor information.

parameters.name: include_geopath
parameters.description: Indicates if the route geopath should be returned

methods.description: View the stopping pattern for a specific trip/service run

parameters.name: run_ref
parameters.description: The run_ref is the identifier of a run as returned by the departures/* and runs/* endpoints. WARNING, run_id is deprecated. Use run_ref instead.

parameters.name: route_type
parameters.description: Number identifying transport mode; values returned via RouteTypes API

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: List of objects to be returned in full (i.e. expanded) - options include: All, Stop, Route, Run, Direction, Disruption, VehiclePosition, VehicleDescriptor and None. Default is Disruption. Run must be expanded to receive VehiclePosition and VehicleDescriptor information.

parameters.name: stop_id
parameters.description: Filter by stop_id; values returned by Stops API

parameters.name: date_utc
parameters.description: Filter by the date and time of the request (ISO 8601 UTC format)

parameters.name: include_skipped_stops
parameters.description: Include any skipped stops in a stopping pattern. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: include_geopath
parameters.description: Indicates if geopath data will be returned (default = false)

methods.description: View stops, routes and myki ticket outlets that match the search term

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: Search text (note: if search text is numeric and/or less than 3 characters, the API will only return routes)

parameters.name: route_types
parameters.description: Filter by route_type; values returned via RouteTypes API (note: stops and routes are ordered by route_types specified)

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Filter by geographic coordinate of latitude

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Filter by geographic coordinate of longitude

parameters.name: max_distance
parameters.description: Filter by maximum distance (in metres) from location specified via latitude and longitude parameters

parameters.name: include_addresses
parameters.description: Placeholder for future development; currently unavailable

parameters.name: include_outlets
parameters.description: Indicates if outlets will be returned in response (default = true)

parameters.name: match_stop_by_suburb
parameters.description: Indicates whether to find stops by suburbs in the search term (default = true)

parameters.name: match_route_by_suburb
parameters.description: Indicates whether to find routes by suburbs in the search term (default = true)

parameters.name: match_stop_by_gtfs_stop_id
parameters.description: Indicates whether to search for stops according to a metlink stop ID (default = false)

methods.description: View all stops near a specific location

parameters.name: route_types
parameters.description: Filter by route_type; values returned via RouteTypes API

parameters.name: max_distance
parameters.description: Filter by maximum distance (in metres) from location specified via latitude and longitude parameters (default = 300)

parameters.name: stop_disruptions
parameters.description: Indicates if stop disruption information will be returned (default = false)

methods.description: View all stops on a specific route

parameters.name: route_id
parameters.description: Identifier of route; values returned by Routes API - v3/routes

parameters.name: route_type
parameters.description: Number identifying transport mode; values returned via RouteTypes API

parameters.name: direction_id
parameters.description: An optional direction; values returned by Directions API. When this is set, stop sequence information is returned in the response.

parameters.name: stop_disruptions
parameters.description: Indicates if stop disruption information will be returned (default = false)

parameters.name: include_geopath
parameters.description: Indicates if geopath data will be returned (default = false)

parameters.name: geopath_utc
parameters.description: Filter geopaths by date (ISO 8601 UTC format) (default = current date)

methods.description: View facilities at a specific stop (Metro and V/Line stations only)

parameters.name: stop_id
parameters.description: Identifier of stop; values returned by Stops API

parameters.name: route_type
parameters.description: Number identifying transport mode; values returned via RouteTypes API

parameters.name: stop_location
parameters.description: Indicates if stop location information will be returned (default = false)

parameters.name: stop_amenities
parameters.description: Indicates if stop amenity information will be returned (default = false)

parameters.name: stop_accessibility
parameters.description: Indicates if stop accessibility information will be returned (default = false)

parameters.name: stop_contact
parameters.description: Indicates if stop contact information will be returned (default = false)

parameters.name: stop_ticket
parameters.description: Indicates if stop ticket information will be returned (default = false)

parameters.name: gtfs
parameters.description: Incdicates whether the stop_id is a GTFS ID or not

parameters.name: stop_staffing
parameters.description: Indicates if stop staffing information will be returned (default = false)

parameters.name: stop_disruptions
parameters.description: Indicates if stop disruption information will be returned (default = false)

apiDescription:
The PTV Timetable API provides direct access to Public Transport Victorias public transport timetable data.

The API returns scheduled timetable, route and stop data for all metropolitan and regional train, tram and bus services in Victoria, including Night Network(Night Train and Night Tram data are included in metropolitan train and tram services data, respectively, whereas Night Bus is a separate route type).

The API also returns real-time data for metropolitan train, tram and bus services (where this data is made available to PTV), as well as disruption information, stop facility information, and access to myki ticket outlet data.

This Swagger is for Version 3 of the PTV Timetable API. By using this documentation you agree to comply with the licence and terms of service.

Train timetable data is updated daily, while the remaining data is updated weekly, taking into account any planned timetable changes (for example, due to holidays or planned disruptions). The PTV timetable API is the same API used by PTV for its apps. To access the most up to date data PTV has (including real-time data) you must use the API dynamically.

You can access the PTV Timetable API through a HTTP or HTTPS interface, as follows:

    base URL / version number / API name / query string
The base URL is either:
  *  http://timetableapi.ptv.vic.gov.au
or
  *  https://timetableapi.ptv.vic.gov.au

The Swagger JSON file is available at http://timetableapi.ptv.vic.gov.au/swagger/docs/v3

Frequently asked questions are available on the PTV website at http://ptv.vic.gov.au/apifaq

Links to the following information are also provided on the PTV website at http://ptv.vic.gov.au/ptv-timetable-api/
* How to register for an API key and calculate a signature
* PTV Timetable API V2 to V3 Migration Guide
* Documentation for Version 2 of the PTV Timetable API
* PTV Timetable API Data Quality Statement

All information about how to use the API is in this documentation. PTV cannot provide technical support for the API.

Credits: This page has been based on Steve Bennett's http://opentransportdata.org/, used with permission.
